name: Shoal Bay Resort & Spa

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a significant (wedding) anniversary treat for us. Extensive internet research had led us to deciding on Shoal Bay Resort and Spa. We had a Heritage 1Br apartment. It was suitably luxurious, and exactly as depicted on the hotel's website.
reviews.title: Great getaway

likes.liked: — Stylish decor, luxurious appointments, very clean
likes.disliked: — Balcony wall so high that you couldn't see the waterfront view when sitting down

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Biggest disappointment, having booked a room with a balcony facing the watefront, was that the balcony wall is so high (probably as protection from the seabreezes) that, when sitting down, you cannot see the view without craning your neck. Glass balcony treatment would be so much better. I hope they consider changing it in the near future!
reviews.title: Beautiful location

reviews.text: We got a last minute mid-week deal, which was satisfactory value for money, but would not have considered staying there for the considerably higher rack rate.
reviews.title: Great location and views

likes.liked: — Large apartments with superb views, new and with all mod cons
likes.disliked: — It made me consider spending more money to stay for a month!!

reviews.text: Staff very willing to assist, but some were quite new and didn't know their way around well enough.
reviews.title: Comfortable and relaxing

reviews.text: The resort is in a beautiful location at Shoal Bay. We had a Heritage apartment, which was lovely with a jacuzzi bath, huge tv and views over the front.
reviews.title: Comfortable spacious traditional hotel

reviews.text: I should probably balance this review by saying that this type of hotel really isn't to our taste generally, so this review is probably biased because of that. We were travelling up the coast over the holiday weekend and this was a the only place that we could get a room - everywhere was booked out. We wouldn't have booked it otherwise.
reviews.title: oh dear

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Firstly the good. The Port Stephens area is beautiful. The beach right outside the resort is nice enough, but take a stroll over to one of the other beaches and you're in for a real treat. Just lovely, quiet, friendly, unspoiled beaches. We wanted a couple of days doing nothing on the beach so this was the one, single thing that made it a great stay.
reviews.title: Good room

reviews.text: As the for the resort itself. It's big, busy, noisy, ugly and has absolutely no charm whatsoever. Rooms are suites and are functional and non descript. Housekeeping woke us up at 8.30 banging on the door even though they tell you it won't be before 10am. Oh and checkout is really early - 10am.
reviews.title: A great family vacation spot!

reviews.text: Breakfast is a do it yourself, all you can eat affair and was almost unbearably bad. The room is messy - food everywhere (all over the floor, the serving counters, the tables); guests are made to wait for breakfast because the team can't keep up with clearing the tables, the food is only just average, and it seems that the staff there can't keep up with the demand as most of the time serving bowls were empty or grubby. Loaves of bread are just dumped on the counter with people rummaging through the bags with their hands (bleurgh). It seems that most people here leave their table manners at the front door - it was truly horrible.
reviews.title: Disappointed . . .

reviews.text: There's a couple of other bars and restaurants in the resort. In the couple of days we were there we visited a few times - no atmosphere; poor service (I asked for a cranberry and soda, the cranberry bottle was nearly empty so instead of getting a new one, the bar steward simply added more soda - what I ended up with was slightly pink soda water, (and he wasn't happy to be challenged either); the places always seemed to be unclean - food all over the floor that isn't cleaned up. One bright light is the restaurant CATCH - the food here was excellent.
reviews.title: great resort- perfect family getaway

description: Shoal Bay Resort & Spa is the ultimate beachfront Resort perfect for romantic escapes, family holidays, pamper weekends, beach getaways, weddings, special events and meetings and business. Shoal Bay lays by the entrance to Port Stephens, overlooking the white sands and the magnificent volcanic Tomaree headlands. Boasting crystal clear waterways and extensive National Park with unspoiled bushland, Shoal Bay is certainly one of New South Wales most stunning destinations. Just 2.5 hr drive north of Sydney and 30mins from Newcastle, this award winning Resort offers a diverse range of accommodation styles and options to suit a variety of budgets and can accommodate up to 700 guests. Accommodation ranges from Standard Studios through to Waterview, Beachfront and Bayview rooms with a choice of 1, 2 and 3 bedroom apartments located across 7 accommodation buildings. The Resort features 4 restaurants including the award winning Catch at Shoal Bay, 5 bars, the iconic Country Club Hotel, Occie’s Kids Club (operating throughout NSW School Holidays periods), Shoal Bay Resort Store, Whitesands Conference Centre, an outdoor heated Resort pool with children’s wading area and complimentary secure undercover parking. Relax at the Aqua Spa wellbeing sanctuary for adults (min 16 yrs+) offering a true Thalassotherapy experience for guests through the 3 mineral spa pools and 25m heated lap pool. Take yourself on a journey to revive your mind, body and soul, indulge in a range of menu treatments that enhance the total well being and surrender to the experience of products that will relax, de-stress and energise you.
